title: MUSIC GEN_MUS 175-0-20 Selected Topics in Music Literature for Non-Majors

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will introduce undergraduate non-music majors to issues of music in Jewish history and culture. Students will gain an understanding of how music shapes personal and communal identity through the study of Jewish liturgical music in its historical development, the depiction of Jewishness in Western art music, and exploration of popular genres throughout the Diaspora. Classroom discussion will focus on how various musics have been used to give voice to, represent, or editorialize Judaism and the Jewish people.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Requirements will include quizzes, weekly writing assignments, attendance at a live musical event, and a final capstone presentation and paper. Previous musical background and familiarity with Jewish topics are helpful, but not required. Readings and musical examples will be made available through Canvas.
